alert.note: Alert for Box Butte; Dawes (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 8:46AM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Box Butte and southeastern Dawes Counties through 830 AM MDT... At 745 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Box Butte Dam, or 19 miles southwest of Hay Springs, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hemingford, Wild Horse Butte, Box Butte Campground, Berea and Box Butte Dam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
